review: netflix app constantly gets logged out & i have to re-enter my email and password.  happens about once every 2 weeks or less.  same thing happens on my fire tv stick as well.both netflix & amazon customer support haven't been able to fix this... i'm guessing amazon's doing something dumb to keep netflix from working properly... i haven't had this problem on any other platforms... i've used netflix on game consoles, roku, google chrome, chromecast, blu ray players... just about every other platform this is available on.  i *never* get logged out of amazon prime.integration with music really sucks.  like, REALLY sucks.  i have a sizeable amazon mp3 collection & navigating to an album is a complete pain in the ass.3d games run really well, surprisingly well.

review: Nice enough but I find the lack of information about using the interface frustrating. Why do I have to purchase the user manual? Perhaps I missed something.  I was so excited to see Meerkat Manor listed as series I could watch only to find all the videos "unavailable". What does that mean? I even went to the Amazon site to purchase them as instant video and can't. Okay. I stuck out on my first attempt but found something else that I enjoyed watching.My biggest criticism, other than the lack of a free user's guide that actually is useful, is that I can't figure out how to stream content from my PC. I don't have and don't need an Amazon Fire tablet. I searched online and can't find any thing that indicates this is possible. I am glad I kept the ChromeCast I got for Christmas. I have two online subscriptions - Lynda.com and Artistnetwork.tv. I can stream the videos to the TV using the Chrome browser and the ChromeCast device. The reason I invested in the Amazon Fire TV is that I can't stream Amazon Prime movies through ChromeCast. My assumption was that I would be able to stream web videos using the Fire TV unit. If I am wrong in my current belief that this isn't possible please advise and tell me how to do this.
author: Amazon Customer
